page.title: 18Liskeard Museum
page.content: The museum opened a few months ago but has already proved to be a popular attraction. While small,there are many interesting exhibits. The walls hold photographs, one of a local school in 1904,and several spears and flags.Also on display are an old typewriter,a rat trap,a hay knife,old helmets, an old fireman's uniform and the bell which used to signal the start of the cattle market. Of particular fascination for local school children is a child's Mickey Mouse gas-mask (a relic of the Second World War) and a life-size model of a woman,in typical costume of a 100 years ago , standing beside an old cash till. On show too,is a book containing the signature of Prince Philip who visited Liskeard in 1956. With free admission,the museum is open everyday except Sunday, from 10-4 week-days and until midday Saturday.
